name: IQE plc
goal:
Manufacturer of advanced compound semiconductor materials for use in micro-electronic and photonic devices for applications in telecommunications, defence, space, automotive, energy efficiency, aerospace, industrial, consumer and health. IQE also offers materials solutions to customers for added-value within the supply-chain. IQE does NOT manufacture devices within the above application areas.

IQE seeks to partner European organisations in R&D&I projects such as Horizon 2020 and ECSEL, as examples, as well as Trans-National funded projects e.g. ERA-NETs and also in Nationally funded projects within the UK. IQE is also active in the first IPCEI (Important Project of Common European Interest) on Microelectronics and heads the Chapter/Technology Field 5 on Compound Materials/Semiconductors.

Project types range from small feasibility studies, through Research and Innovation projects up to Pilot-Line scale (Innovation Actions) and in First Industrial Deployment as related to the afore-mentioned scheme, the Important Project of Common European Interest on Microelectronics.

IQE is active in several European industry organisations such as Photonics21, the European Photonics Industry Consortium, High-Level KET Group, Electronics Leadership Group, Aeneas, and in projects schemes run by the European Space Agency and European Defence Agency.

In the IPCEI on Microelectronics - granted in Dec 2018 - and leading the Technology Field on Compound Semiconductors, IQE is collaborating with many leading European industries on near-market First Industrial Deployment activities - in conjunction with Member States and COM
interests: Communication, Competition, Digital economy and society, Energy, Environment, Food Safety, Public Health, Research and innovation, Trans-European Networks
euInitiatives: Framework 7, Horizon 2020/Europe, ECSEL, IPCEI, P21, EPIC, ESA, EDA, IPCEI, PENTA, EUREKA, ERANETs
